titleStmt.title: How to automatically update your TEI framework in oXygen
titleStmt.author: Elisa Beshero-Bondar
James Cummings

sourceDesc.p: Based on James Cummings' blog posting at

revisionDesc.change: Began drafting this tutorial, adapting and updating James's language from his blog site.

body.p: Much of the TEI community relies on the <oXygen/> XML Editor to provide the most up-to-date frameworks for the TEI, including element specs, schema validation rules, and transformation scenarios packaged with the latest releases of the TEI Guidelines. The TEI Consortium and <oXygen/> jointly maintain an open source and openly-licensed oxygen-tei framework at .

In this guide, we explain how to add and install the oXygen TEI plugin to keep the TEI framework up to date with new releases of the TEI Guidelines and Stylesheets. Keeping your framework up to date will ensure that current TEI encoding projects are checked for validity against updates to the TEI-All schema and that you have access to the latest additions (new elements and attributes for example) in the TEI Guidelines. Releases of the TEI Guidelines come roughly twice per year and the oXygen TEI plugin will help ensure you have access to the latest release of the TEI source code. Follow the steps outlined here to install the oXygen TEI plugin.

list.item: In the Options menu, select Preferences. Then select Add-ons, as shown in the figure below.

Click on the Add button to add a new Add-on, and in the pop-up window that appears, paste in this URL: . This is the oXygen-TEI add-on file which is updated every time there is a TEI Guidelines or Stylesheets release. Click OK to add it to your list of available add-ons.
Back in the Preferences window in Add-ons, be sure that the Enable automatic updates checking is checked, and click OK.
Now we need to install the Add-on. In the Help menu, click on Install new add-ons....
